contentheadline.headline: Flag of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic

contentrichtext.text: [[File:Flag of Georgian SSR.svg|thumb|300px|Flag of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic]] The '''flag of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic''' was adopted by the [[Georgian SSR]] on April 11, 1951. Prior to this, the flag was red with the [[Georgian alphabet|Georgian]] characters სსსრ (''SSSR'') in gold in the top-left corner. Between 1937 and the adoption of the above flag in the 1940s, the flag was red, with the [[Georgian alphabet|Georgian]] characters საქართველოს სსრ (''Sakartvelos SSR'') in gold in the top-left corner. Between 1922 and 1937, the flag was red, with the [[Cyrillic script|Cyrillic]] characters ''ССРГ'' (''SSRG'') in the top left-hand corner.
